resources.string: Start and stop operation of the Robotic Sorting System.
Welcome to the Robotic Sorting System
See information about the Robotic Sorting System and its developers.
The Robotic Sorting System is the capstone design project of Pace Dominy, Joseph Miller, and Lam Tran. It was created in the 2022â€“2023 academic year at Texas A&M University.

For any issues with the system whose cause or solution cannot easily be determined or resolved, please contact Pace Dominy at pacedominy7@tamu.edu, Joseph Miller at josephmiller954@tamu.edu, or Lam Tran at lamandrew@tamu.edu.
See diagnostic information and current readouts from the Robotic Sorting System.
Set the sorting parameters for the Robotic Sorting System.
Configure the Robotic Sorting System to sort using size cutoffs.
Enter the cutoff size in inches. Fruits larger in diameter than this value will be sorted into one bin while larger fruits will go into another.
For two-bin sorting, fruits with diameters smaller than Size 1 will be placed in Bin 1. Fruits with diameters larger than Size 1 will be placed in bin 2.
For two-bin sorting, leave Size 2 blank.

For three-bin sorting, add a number for Size 2. Fruits with diameters smaller than Size 1 will be placed in Bin 1. Fruits with diameters between Size 1 and Size 2 will be placed in Bin 2. Fruits with diameters larger than Size 2 will be placed in Bin 3.
Configure the Robotic Sorting System to sort using color cutoffs.
Configure the Robotic Sorting System to sort defective and healthy fruit.
Pressing the "Send Configuration to System" button will configure the Robotic Sorting System to sort healthy fruit into Bin 1 and defective fruit into bin 2.
